snippet: The slow spread of the illness, which has killed 45 people, mostly in the Middle East, has not prompted travel restrictions as of yet.
abstract: World Health Organization says slow spread of MERS virus that has killed 45 people, mostly in the Middle East, does not amount to a global health emergency, and no travel restrictions will be issued now.
lead_paragraph: The slow spread of the illness, which has killed 45 people, mostly in the Middle East, has not prompted travel restrictions as of yet.

headline.main: MERS Virus Not Global Emergency, Health Officials Say
headline.print_headline: MERS Virus Is Not Being Considered Global Emergency
